column4: What do you think about ubuntu 10.10 I just got a new laptop that came with windows 7 on it so im trying to decide if I should stay with Windows 7 or go with ubuntu
Well I use ubuntu on my older laptop
Im learning to do C++ and OpenGL but one question is can I compile it to work on windows
opengl and C++ are standardized so if you stick to standards it will work on both
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3m1rroUS_0g
this is ubuntu support ONLY. Please take all other chats to #ubuntu-offtopic   thanks
I've seen this.you need a boot option. I think its something like proto=imps
you'll need that as a modprobe option in one of the files in /etc/modprobe.d
open one of the conf files in /etc/modprobe.d and add; options psmouse prot=imps ,save the new file andclose the editor
then run: sudo modprobe -r psmouse; sleep 5; sudo modprobe psmouse
depends on tastes and requirements
then its great, it can do all thatstuff
The question is does it work with all my hardware
should be ok, you may need some tweaks
most of your stuff will be fine
This is my laptop
should be fine, you may need a boot option to get the touchpad to play well, otherwise it a standard lappy
well I booted the livecd and my touchpad worked btw what version should I go with the x86 or x64 its an amd athlon x2 dual core 2.2 GHz and it has 4GB of ram
it's a 64bit chip so you can use either. I'd go for 64bit personally, it will help your compiling.
Ok thanks btw do you program at all
how does it connect to the system?
run:    lsusb    and use the 8 character hex ID to find guides.
most times, Netgear uses ndiswrapper (ndisgtk) plus the windows driver
